abstract: Somewhat Homomorphic Encryption (SHE) schemes allow to carry out operations on data in the cipher domain. In a cloud computing scenario, personal informations can be processed without compromising their confidentiality. However, due to the size of primitives of SHE, a pure software implementation is time consuming. That is why several alternatives consist on accelerating Homomorphic Encryption on FPGA. Because recent Homomorphic schemes base their arithmetic in a ring of polynomials reduced by an irreducible one, hardware accelerator implements fast polynomial arithmetic with FFT algorithm. However, this approach has several constraints and requires a large amount of hardware resources. In this paper, we use Karatsuba algorithm to accelerate SHE in hardware and we demonstrate that for various sizes and parameters, Karatsuba can be a good alternative to FFT. For a multiplicative depth of 4, our accelerator performs an homomorphic multiplication of Fan-Vercauteren (FV) scheme in 11.9 ms instead of 15.46 ms with other state of the art approaches, with 50% logic savings.
